Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into five registers: 1 - Winged sun-disc, below is a barque containing the deceased and four gods, jackals on either side. 2 - Central sun-disc flanked by kneeling female mourners and representations of Ra(?). 3 - Male figure supporting the sun-disc on top of his head flanked by ba-birds, cynocephali and worshippers. 4 - Seated male and female figure before an offering-table and figure carrying a libation-vase and incense-burner. 5 - Five rows of Hieroglyphic text.
Curator's comments: Minas-Nerpel, Der Gott Chepri (OLA 154, 2006), 338, note 941. Munro, Die Spatagyptischen Totenstelae, 2, Bde., AFO 25 1973, 315, pl. 49.
